body: This list of investments is not meant to be exhaustive; NPC ingenuity could open up all sorts of investments. Some research on medieval and Renaissance technology reveals many ideas the people of those times used to make their lives easier, and some of those ideas can easily become an investment opportunity for the PCs. This section details how particular investments might serve as plot hooks for the PCs involved.
name: Example Investments and Problems
url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems

sections.body: The entertainers are more volatile or political than the investor had imagined.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Arts
sections.name: Arts

sections.body: The investor's theoretically impenetrable vault is cracked and the valuables stolen.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Banking
sections.name: Banking

sections.body: A labor strike, bandit activity, or an unscrupulous rival blocks access to needed materials.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Crafting
sections.name: Crafting

sections.body: An explorer ends up being unreliable, greedy, or incautious, accidentally releasing ancient evils on an unsuspecting populace.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Exploration
sections.name: Exploration

sections.body: The building catches on fire, either from a simple accident or deliberate arson, and the aerosolized grain causes a massive explosion.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Granary_Mill
sections.name: Granary/Mill

sections.body: A rival guild targets the investor's employees, friends, family, or buildings.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Guild
sections.name: Guild

sections.body: Enemies of the client see a shipment as an opportunity to humiliate or kill the PC and acquire valuable goods.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Imports
sections.name: Imports

sections.body: The invention fails spectacularly and dangerously, putting the surrounding populace at risk.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Invention
sections.name: Invention

sections.body: A client you're protecting betrays an assassin's guild, is branded as a heretic by an influential church, or insults a prominent member of the ruling elite.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Protection
sections.name: Protection

sections.body: Miners discover a strange hazard such as mutation-inducing crystals or a cave complex full of dangerous monsters.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Quarry
sections.name: Quarry

sections.body: The research goes awry, or falls into the hands of blackmailers, criminals intent on using it for evil, or rival researchers.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Research
sections.name: Research

sections.body: Sabotage or a deadly accident occurs, or a rustler steals the most valuable mounts.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Stable
sections.name: Stable

sections.body: Overheard plans for an ambush spark rumors and property damage.
sections.name: Tavern
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Campaign Systems/Investment/Example Investments and Problems/Tavern
